questions.question: What is a computer?

options.b: An electronic device that processes data and produces information.
options.c: A tool for storing and organizing physical documents.
options.d: A device used for communication purposes.

questions.answer: b) An electronic device that processes data and produces information.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of a computer?

options.b: Accuracy
options.c: Reliability

questions.answer: d) Creativity

questions.question: What is the purpose of programs in a computer?

options.b: To process data and produce output
options.c: To display information on the screen

questions.answer: b) To process data and produce output

questions.question: What is the difference between data and information?

options.a: Data is processed, while information is unprocessed.
options.b: Data is meaningful, while information is raw facts.
options.c: Data is the end-product of data processing, while information is unprocessed facts.
options.d: Data is unprocessed facts, while information is processed and meaningful data.

questions.answer: d) Data is unprocessed facts, while information is processed and meaningful data.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of a computer's storage capacity?

options.a: Large storage in a small space
options.b: Protection of data with passwords
options.c: Ability to store data for later use

questions.answer: d) Limited storage capacity

questions.question: What does GIGO stand for in relation to computers?

options.b: Garbage In, Garbage Out
options.c: Good Information, Good Output

questions.answer: b) Garbage In, Garbage Out

questions.question: How does a computer ensure accuracy in its operations?

options.b: By having built-in error-detection and correction mechanisms
options.c: By relying on human intervention
options.d: By performing tasks at a slow pace

questions.answer: b) By having built-in error-detection and correction mechanisms

questions.question: What advantage does a computerized system have over a manual system?

options.b: Reduced storage capacity
options.c: Limited functionality

questions.answer: a) Increased speed and accuracy

questions.question: In which field can computers be used for decision-making?

options.b: Agriculture
options.c: Finance

questions.answer: d) All of the above

questions.question: What is the unit used to measure the speed of a computer?

options.b: Megahertz (MHz) or gigahertz (GHz)
options.c: Kilograms

questions.answer: b) Megahertz (MHz) or gigahertz (GHz)

questions.question: How does automation apply to computers?

options.a: Computers can work without any instructions.
options.b: Computers can perform tasks automatically based on predefined instructions.
options.c: Computers can only perform one specific task.
options.d: Computers can make decisions on their own.

questions.answer: b) Computers can perform tasks automatically based on predefined instructions.

questions.question: What is the role of passwords in computer systems?

options.a: To prevent unauthorized access to stored data.
options.b: To increase the speed of the computer.
options.c: To improve the accuracy of the computer.
options.d: To enhance the versatility of the computer.

questions.answer: a) To prevent unauthorized access to stored data.

questions.question: How does a computer handle errors during its operation?

options.a: By ignoring errors and continuing with the process.
options.b: By displaying error messages and stopping the process.
options.c: By automatically correcting errors without any intervention.
options.d: By shutting down immediately to prevent further errors.

questions.answer: b) By displaying error messages and stopping the process.

questions.question: What are the essential characteristics of information?

options.b: Vague, outdated, incomplete, and irrelevant
options.c: Inaccurate, delayed, complex, and unnecessary

questions.answer: a) Accurate, timely, complete, and relevant

questions.question: How can computers contribute to increased productivity in the workplace?

options.a: By slowing down processes for accuracy.
options.b: By reducing the need for human involvement.
options.c: By creating more paperwork and manual tasks.
options.d: By decreasing the storage capacity of important data.

questions.answer: b) By reducing the need for human involvement.

questions.question: In which real-life scenario would a computer be most useful?

options.b: Cooking a gourmet meal
options.c: Writing a novel by hand

questions.answer: a) Managing a small business inventory

questions.question: How are computers used in the field of education?

options.b: To facilitate online learning and research
options.c: To write exams on behalf of students

questions.answer: b) To facilitate online learning and research

questions.question: What is the role of output devices in a computer system?

options.b: To process data and produce output
options.c: To store data and instructions temporarily
options.d: To display or present processed information

questions.answer: d) To display or present processed information

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an input device?

options.b: Monitor
options.c: Keyboard

questions.answer: c) Keyboard

questions.question: How can computers be used in the entertainment industry?

options.b: To create special effects in films
options.c: To compose music without human involvement
options.d: To discourage creativity in artistic endeavors

questions.answer: b) To create special effects in films
